website_summaries.verdict: The Junglecat is reminiscent of the Nintendo Switch with its precise controls, ergonomic grip, and premium design, making it worth the price for dedicated mobile gaming.
pros: Includes 3 cases to perfectly fit your smartphone
Companion app for customizing button layouts

customer_reviews.title: Super LOUD clicking, forget about using this on travel!
customer_reviews.text: This might be a good product, but the buttons are so clicky and loud that you can forget about using this when traveling without bothering everyone around you. Really regret spending all that money on this.
customer_reviews.author: preben nylokken

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Compatible Games
customer_reviews.text: While highly interesting, the amount of compatible games is lacking. I saw this as a way to not have to bring my Xbox controller, but considering that this particular product has hardly and games that can be used with it doesn't make me feel like holding onto it. Furthermore, the games that were 100% compatible didn't even have the accurate response time even after tweaking the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This is only compatible with three phones...
customer_reviews.text: I made an assumption that this was similar to many of the tension based joypads on the market. I have so many Razer products that I figured this would also be another one to add to my collection. Unfortunately I do not have a Razer Phone or Samsung Phone. So it is not going to work out like I planned... Button wise - it is solid, I like the feedback. One thing I will note - there was no USB-C power cable in the box, since this needs two of them to recharge, one for each side, it would have been nice to see a dual head usb-c cable included.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bittan

customer_reviews.title: Was 5 stars now 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: The controller works fine and can work with any device that supports bluetooth controller, I'm using this for my galaxy tab s6 no problem at all but the protector case that comes with the controller only works with 3 phones Razer phone 2, Galaxy s10 plus, and Galaxy note 9 and in the near future 3rd party seller will made more case for other phone's. Update: the controller is starting to fail after 2 months, the games I'm playing is acting as if I'm pushing those buttons and I'm not and is a hassle to return, maybe I should have waited a few months after it was released to see if they fix this problems.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Knight

customer_reviews.title: if you want to game this isnt the way.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Razer 2 phone and continually have issues with bluetooth connectivity. While playing the bluetooth will disconnect and inhibit my actions in whatever game I am playing. Also the controllers are a bit small for my hands (average man hand size). If you have an xbox controller with bluetooth I would recommend just playing with that and buying one of those controller clips for the phone. If you have to purchase one its only about $60 so its cheaper than this anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Stansell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good if you're really into mobile gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product. The controller, as a whole, are smaller than Nintendo's Joycons, but only about an inch and a half. Battery is pretty solid for the most part. I've been using them off and on, and I didn't have to recharge them yet. My only gripe with these controllers are the button placement. It will take some time for your hands to get used to the placement of the thumb sticks and the buttons. After that, they work pretty well. Also, they kinda work well with my Dolphin Emulator. Maybe it's because of the bluetooth controls or I don't have my buttons mapped out correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: not bad for price
customer_reviews.text: not bad controller has that switch feel too it only thing i hate is how the analog sticks are setup doesn’t really bother me when i’m playing racing games or fighting ones but if i’m playing a game like cod mobile or area F2 or modern combat 5 i find the stick n button placements awkward works well with emulators tho i’d give 5 stars if they put the right analog stick at the bottom / below or underneath the buttons on the right
customer_reviews.author: xscxro

customer_reviews.title: Expensive? Yep. Worth every penny? Yep.
customer_reviews.text: This thing does everything I wanted it to do. It turned my phone into the ultimate emulation powerhouse. The controls are great and it feels wonderful in the hands. I disagree with any of the complaints about it feeling flimsy or making too loud of clicking noises while using it (as if anybody on an airplane could possibly hear your game controller). If you have one of the phone models that supports it and want the best of the best, look no further. Roar, Junglecat. Roar.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: It looks like switch joycons, right? Unfortunately, they are much smaller than actual joy-cons. Unlike the ubiquitous "xbox controller" layout that has become the standard, the joystick is near the top on the right side with the buttons below. Which makes this controller extremely uncomfortable to use as you have nothing to hold onto when trying to use the buttons due to how small the controllers are. Charging it is a hassle as you need 3 USB-C cords: 1 for your phone, 1 for the left side, and 1 for the right side. 2 stars for requiring 2 tiny hands to use.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for release - Feels like a proof of concept
customer_reviews.text: The device was not well thought out. The controllers randomly De-synch and the software only works with a few games. The whole format feels like it was designed to work with only paying devs and feels like a cheap knock-off of a nintendo switch. ( I use to love Razer products but they have really gone down hill over the last few years.
customer_reviews.author: Anime Guy

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works well
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works very well! However, not many apps play nicely. The overlay mode (and the app along with it) is garbage, don't even attempt it. COD mobile and PUBG mobile don't recognize it. Most emulators, on the other hand, do work well with it. It's a great way to play N64 games on Android! Look up app compatibility before buying, if your favorite games are included.
customer_reviews.author: Skayruggs

customer_reviews.title: great product, only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this. There isn't any lag between the controller and game being played. Excellent quality. The only downfall is that if you chose to use the controller connected to the phone as pictured, there is no way to charge the phone. Very limited amount of time being able to play without having to charge the phone. It would have been better if they included some way to charge the phone while have the controller hooked up to the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome concept, not satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This one was tough to review, I bought to try the new X streaming service. The case is too lose for my liking, and that also gives the remote on the top side of the phone a looser feel( button port feels firmer ) Rather buy something like a telescopic controller in which I can keep my Spigen case on.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Zamalot

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it rn and do research on the game you want it to connect the controller
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time writing a review on Amazon. This product as of right now sucks for it's price and they didn't tell you that it only work on fortnite and some other super-low games you never even heard before. They didn't give out a list that it's not capable of using it for pubg, call of duty and other highly popular shooting games. I would not recommend this to anyone that doesn't have a job that saves their money to buy this controller and ended up disappointing yourself
customer_reviews.author: Jalille Cristobal

customer_reviews.title: Great controllers!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical for the price, but pairing them is easy, they have good build quality, and they work for emulators/steamlink. That's all k can ask for. If you don't have a phone that can fit the included cases this might not be the perfect option for you, but an industrious person can probably make something work with some tools, adhesives, and the included cases.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Getting there but not there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Close but no cigar. It took me some getting used to the small buttons and form factor. But it makes your phone look and feel great! Not compatible with all games but you can figure out the settings. This is absolutely heading in the right direction.
customer_reviews.author: Jhonny Augustin

customer_reviews.title: Software will get you banned on multiplayer games.
customer_reviews.text: It works great 👍😀. The only bad thing about it is that the software the controller uses to overlay buttons on games that don't have controller support will get you banned......LOL!!!! hopefully my bann is removed at some point. (The game was CODM if you most know.)
customer_reviews.author: N3-C45

customer_reviews.title: One of the better controllers I've used
customer_reviews.text: I have a galaxy note 10+. Technically it's not made to fit my model, but modifying the mount needed to connect the controllers was pretty easy using my Dremel to cut away the plastic over the power button and camera cutout. Be careful tho! Works great! Nice feel when pressing the buttons. Favorite controller so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kordel

customer_reviews.title: A controller made for Ants
customer_reviews.text: Ackward button layout. Most mobile games use left joystick and abxy layout -- Why Razer decided to use double top joystick is a BIG DUMB BRAIN!! Directional buttons feel very cramped. Lots of unsupported games. Even AAA like CoD Mobile is unsupported. Hot garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my Razer Phone 2. Works with a lot more games than advertised. Those that it does work with, it works flawlessly. You will just have to try a game out and see if it is supported. The octopus overlay does not work for me though so that was a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Bachus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing controller... 5 Stars ALLDAY...
customer_reviews.text: Im not one ro pay 100 dollars for a controller especially for my phone. But i would highly recommend this controller... its quality,feel,and low to no larency is the best ever so far... have it now for about 8 months and no complaints whatsoever... i play stadia and xbox streaming on my note 9 and never have drop signal or latency problems... i have a not 9 and its amazing, it is like having a ps4 or xbox one switch on the go... use it while im working, in bed, or in the crapper... 5 stars allday!!! Well worth the price...
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Buttons STICK
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed using this product until the buttons started sticking. My game characters would keep running when I stop and have to jiggle it to unstick the direction pad. I am a very clean person so it wasn't due to dirt, food or drinks. I ended up throwing this away and just sticking to my mouse and key board. Don't buy. Great latency though.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Speaker

customer_reviews.title: small and cramped
customer_reviews.text: If you have big hands, this is not the controller for you. The joystick placement is also uncomfortable over longer playing sessions. You will also have to take your phone out of it's current case and put it into a special case that allows the controllers to be mounted on the sides. it gets old very quick and the case is not fine I'd want to keep on my phone long term. this greatly reduces the convenience factor of playing a few games while sitting on the couch, waiting at an appt, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Long last battery
customer_reviews.text: It has amazing battery, it last for days, the sticks feels a little uncomfortable, it would be better if the sticks had been placed in the lower part of the controller, as a ps controller, or at least just the right stick.
customer_reviews.author: IsaiSosa

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly rugged.
customer_reviews.text: Case inexplicably broke in corner. Razer support took weeks to reply, despite the original estimate of a day or two. Barely used it for two or three hours. Returned. Also alarming there doesn't seem to be a way to buy extra cases for it?
customer_reviews.author: What.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a small design flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for emulators and Xcloud! Though I wish the buttons were above the analog on the right controller and is a little funky to move your thumb down to hit them. But all and all this is nicer to carry than a Xbox controller.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, but repeated connection issues.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second pair of these and they are having the same issue. The secondary controller (which connects to the one that connects to your phone) keeps disconnecting every thirty seconds. Apparently this is a common issue with Razer Phones, which seems pretty ridiculous given this is a Razer controller. I've tried everything and tech support could offer no solutions, so looks like I'm just going to submit for a refund. Real shame.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Barley ever write product reviews but this thing is awsome. You can setup capable keys and play any game after an additional plugin install for button overlays. Defenitly worth it
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Seymour

customer_reviews.title: so-so
customer_reviews.text: Confused product. Light and portable, feels "game-boyish" pressing the controls which I like for the nostalgia; but should be more directed for console style controls.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend!🎮
customer_reviews.text: It's not comfortable to hold at all, would probably be better for smaller children since the controllers are small. It's also not stable at all even with the phone cases that Razer provided. The button arrangement makes you strain you're fingers too much, nice concept but let's see if they come out with something better.
customer_reviews.author: Chino

customer_reviews.title: If you have a phone that's compatible it's amazing
customer_reviews.text: Incredible battery life. Works great with project xcloud emulators Google stadia and much more if you have a phone that's compatible you will not find a better controller or more portable controller than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Due to loose usb c port on my Razer Phone 2 I can no longer use my Razer Kishi. Bought Razer Junglecat with high hopes which were then quickly dashed by Bluetooth disconnecttivity issues. All Razer productsand all with known product issues. Avoid Razer mobile products.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sab

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for gamers. Perfect for Xbox xCloud Game streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Corbo

customer_reviews.title: Consistent connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Consistent connection issues, contacted support which was a bit slow and recived replacement unit which is also defective. Connection drops every few seconds making the product unsusable despite resetting controller, phone, using different phone, updating firmware, etc. No solution to the fact that the product simply doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: martin palacio

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works but sometimes faulty
customer_reviews.text: Bought this solely for emulators. Works great when it works. Once in a while the d-pad runs it's own course. For example, the character would walk to the right although I'm not pressing anything. Makes me think if it's the hardware or just my unit alone. So far happens with 3 different emulators. Same thing. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Soua

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I have the Galaxy S10 + and it holds it perfectly! Not flimsy ... buttons are really clicky (which I love!) This is an amazing controller if you have the right phone! This is the BEST controller in the market right now!
customer_reviews.author: BCangemi

customer_reviews.title: Really good controller but it could do more.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the controller but it is not as effective as it could be since it uses a plugin called Octopus that is banned in most FPS games. If there was a better integration it would be 100% better but it has good build quality, less conforatble that the Switch controllers but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good controller for the right games
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller it works great but understand that it doesn't work for all games like PUBG or cod, for games like Castlevania symphony of the night it works great! But please understand that you need to know if it works for the games you want to play before you purchase this controller.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It sure will give you the switch, but it's not a switch.
customer_reviews.text: $99.99 doesn't make things better. Wanting to play a game with the controller? Root your phone would give you more opportunities than this $100.
customer_reviews.author: ihereou

customer_reviews.title: Poor button layout for handling games accurately
customer_reviews.text: For the price it seems like a gimmick, poor button layout, in most cases the games are controlled better on screen. Not enough games exsist that are compatible for the price of this.
customer_reviews.author: timothy spalding

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about how this controller responds. Just wish it had a universal case. Other than that best Android controller on the market hands down
customer_reviews.author: zerolungpower

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device that has exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy setup! Purchased with the Razer 2 phone. Feels like a real video game console. Works great with my Xbox streaming service, emulators and just about every game I’ve tried on it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Justo Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: No call of duty support
customer_reviews.text: This controller will get you banned on call of duty mobile due to a plug in it runs, if you dont care about playing the best shooter in mobile gaming then by all means go for it. for me sadly this has been a huge drawback
customer_reviews.author: miguel arnulfo contreras

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Works as a controller for emulators, but not really comfortable after long sessions of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No lag
customer_reviews.text: 30ms bluetooth, no lag and smooth game play (feel like wired connection)
customer_reviews.author: Sotheanat Sreng

customer_reviews.title: Great but only for a time
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted but it stopped working last night after 5 months of moderate use. Don't bother with this model, maybe the newly released Kenshi will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Jungle cat
customer_reviews.text: Ist very good and portable controller to use for x-cloud my only gripe is my hands are on the large side for playing games for to long.
customer_reviews.author: Maxas20

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: It's werid that's on the box they have Fortnite Avatars and my little bro could not play Fortnite with them.
customer_reviews.author: Rosendo Arzate

customer_reviews.title: Durability issue
customer_reviews.text: Case for Razer phone 2 broke. Never dropped. Would not recommend for durability purposes. Other than that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Dalvin A Holloman

customer_reviews.title: it ain't good.
customer_reviews.text: Not cool at all, uses Bluetooth and needs overlay to work on non supported games and that doesn't even work well.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Brasher

customer_reviews.title: Great Controller... Until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Great controller which worked and paired well with my Razer Phone until the right controller stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Wei

customer_reviews.title: Great Gamepad
customer_reviews.text: Favorite gamepad works great with Xcloud beware it's not compatible with Call of duty Mobile
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Moore

product_meta.title: Razer Junglecat Dual-Sided Mobile Game Controller for Android: Modular Design - 100 Hr Battery Life - Bluetooth Low-Latency - Compatible w/ Razer Phone 2, Galaxy Note 9, Galaxy S10+
product_meta.description: Enjoy the accuracy and advantage of having twin analog thumbsticks and bumper buttons, all in a compact, ergonomic form that delivers comfortable handheld gaming. Adjusted via the Razer Gamepad app, allowing for more precise aiming when the need arises—crucial for FPS games.
feature_bullets: Portable dual-sided controller for enhanced mobile gaming precision
Modular design for total flexibility and personalization
Razer Gamepad app for integrated game support and custom button mapping
Low latency connection for seamless button response
Bluetooth low energy for longer battery life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars255 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
